intro: Ogcodeia pseudonaga, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture with a waxy coating. Ogcodeia pseudonaga is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and thrives in well-drained soils.
